title: Whether the "switch to new tab" option is on or off, Firefox does jump to it
content:
Hey, hope you're well

I'd prefer opening new tabs to happen in the background, so I can stay on the original page.

So far, Firefox seems to open new links and will switch to them immediately, automatically.

I checked in settings, and found the setting in the attached image.

I found that whether this setting was checked or unchecked, the behavior remained the same.

Any suggestions?

Thanks in advance
creator: do-the-thing

title: Firefox logo Youtube most of the time has terrible connection speed
content: YouTube videos I try to load get stuck around 500-1200 kbps connection speed inside of the stats for nerds section. I had this same problem about a week ago and the solution I was told was this was the problem: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1415738#answer-1585257. I changed it and it made it better, sometimes videos would load at full speed, which is about 400 Mbps when I went to 4k, but most of the time I have to keep refreshing until I get full speed. It's so weird, and I don't have the problem with other browsers, but I prefer to use Firefox, what do I do?
creator: Firefox696969

title: Firefox after today's update 114.0.2
content:

Reinstalling FF Restarting desktop Have produced no positive outcome. Even update can't be checked( if it has been updated)

          Thanking You,

title: I just want to open a .pdf file online . . . but Firefox insists on downloading it!
content:
OS: Mac OS 10.14.5 Firefox Version: 113.0.2

Settings gives me multiple options for handling a .pdf file. The first three are (1) Open in Firefox; (2) Always ask; and (3) Save File.

If I select "Open in Firefox," the file will open in my existing window. If I select "Save File," the file downloads to my desktop.

The problem arises when I select "Always ask." If I then select "Open in Firefox," the file opens (in a new tab!) and simultaneously downloads to my desktop!

Is this a system glitch, or am I somehow doing something wrong?
creator: nhcowboy1

title: Cannot Log into Facebook in on Firefox
content:
To the Support:

After the update 114.02 to Firefox, I was unable to log into my Facebook account, while it it not an issue at all on Edge and the Troubleshoot Mode. No new add-on installed before this glitch arised.

Could you please look into this issue, thank you!
creator: samsonzhong

title: I am trying to use Firefox as a browser, but all the text is blurry. This doesn't happen in Chrome or Edge.
content: I want to use Firefox as a browser, but the text displayed is blurry. What can I do? I don't have this problem in Chrome or in Edge.
